intro: Pentacalia streptothamna, commonly known as the spiral-leaved pentacalia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its distinctive spiral arrangement of leaves, which gives it a unique and ornamental appearance. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, blooming in the summer months. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland areas or along stream banks. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
